__comments.purpose: This file defines the DEFAULT prompt-style structure for any new channel. setup_folders.py copies this file into Channels/<Channel>/Config/prompt_style.json when a new channel is initialized.
__comments.instructions: AI tools may read this file to understand the schema and expected fields. Do NOT remove keys; instead update per-channel prompt_style.json or channel_policy.py for customization.

global.prompt_prefix: Optional text automatically prepended to every scene prompt. Leave empty for LLM-driven prompts.
global.prompt_suffix: Optional text automatically appended to every scene prompt. Leave empty unless needed for a channel.
global.negative_prompt: A comma-separated list of forbidden visual elements. Global defaults are minimal; channels can extend this in their prompt_style.json.

style.art_style: High-level aesthetic of the channel (cinematic, painterly, documentary). AI tools should fill this based on channel identity.
style.tone: Emotional tone of visuals (serious, dramatic, neutral).
style.people_style: How people should look in visuals (stylized, realistic, historical).
style.palette: Preferred color palette for the channel (muted, warm, cold).
style.camera: Preferred framing: wide, medium tableaus, close-ups.

llm.channel_theme: List of high-level themes (finance, history, tech). Guides LLM scene writing.
llm.target_audience: Description of typical audience; helps LLM pick tone.
llm.avoid: List of elements that LLM should avoid when generating prompts.
llm.style_notes: Free-form hints that influence LLM style decisions for all scenes.

__comments.rules: Reserved for future rule-based prompt transformations.
__comments.fallback_template: Name of a template used when LLM is unavailable.
__comments.templates: Map of fallback templates. LLM-powered systems rarely need these, but they must exist for safety.

global.negative_prompt: text, words, letters, captions, subtitles, logos, UI, infographics
